perturbation.original_text:
XC may terminate this Agreement upon written notice to AJR upon the occurrence of any of the following events (each an "AJR Event of Default"):

                (i)     AJR breaches any material term, provision or covenant of                         this  Agreement  on the  part of AJR to be  observed  or                         performed  and such breach is not cured  within ten (10)                         days after written  notice of the breach is given by XC;                         or
perturbation.changed_text:
XC may terminate this Agreement upon written notice to AJR upon the occurrence of any of the following events (each an "AJR Event of Default"):

                (i)     AJR breaches any material term, provision or covenant of                         this  Agreement  on the  part of AJR to be  observed  or                         performed  and such breach is not cured  within two (2)                         days after written  notice of the breach is given by XC;                         or
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows a 10-day cure period for breaches. Reducing this to 2 days creates non-compliance, as Virginia law may imply a reasonable cure period, which is likely longer than 2 days for material breaches.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing under Virginia contract law.

not been filed with the Securities and Exchange  Commission on or before July 1, 2002, XC agrees to pay to AJR $10,000.
